page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Lying between the Berwyn mountains to the west and the undulating north Shropshire plain to the east, this area is characterised by hills and valleys. Standing at high points one is surrounded by picturesque valleys of green. Small tree-lined streams babble along in these{valleys.}The whole countryside is green, though much influenced by man. Most of the land is used for agriculture, improved {grassland}predominating. Noticeable areas of{coniferous trees}planted within the past forty years add a sylvan touch to the area. However the Candy Woods are mainly{deciduous,}and are threatened by plans to fell them for their timber. The tranquillity of this rural domain contrasts vividly with the hustle and bustle of townscapes.
